docs.lead_paragraph: Even with legislatures in summer recess, there's no lull in the battle over state anti-abortion laws as several federal courts decide whether to uphold or strike down some of the most sweeping measures.

headline.main: Tough Anti-Abortion Laws Examined in Federal Court
headline.print_headline: Tough Anti-Abortion Laws Examined in Federal Court

docs.snippet: Even with legislatures in summer recess, there's no lull in the battle over state anti-abortion laws as several federal courts decide whether to uphold or strike down some of the most sweeping measures.

docs.lead_paragraph: For thousands of well-off childless couples, the dream of having a baby is often realized in places like Thailand and India. Ready to help them are young women who become paid surrogates, their wombs offered up as vessels that can safely carry the babies until they are born.

headline.main: Thai Case Casts Spotlight on Business of Surrogacy
headline.print_headline: Thai Case Casts Spotlight on Business of Surrogacy

docs.snippet: For thousands of well-off childless couples, the dream of having a baby is often realized in places like Thailand and India. Ready to help them are young women who become paid surrogates, their wombs offered up as vessels that can safely carry the...

docs.lead_paragraph: Thailand pushed to ban commercial surrogacy Thursday as a case involving nine surrogate babies allegedly with the same Japanese father emerged just days after a furor over the alleged abandonment of a surrogate-born baby with Down syndrome.

headline.main: Thailand Pushes to Ban Commercial Surrogacy
headline.print_headline: Thailand Pushes to Ban Commercial Surrogacy

docs.snippet: Thailand pushed to ban commercial surrogacy Thursday as a case involving nine surrogate babies allegedly with the same Japanese father emerged just days after a furor over the alleged abandonment of a surrogate-born baby with Down syndrome.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Indianapolis woman whose co-workers found her newborn son gasping for air in a garbage can told a detective she expected the boy to die after she gave birth in a warehouse restroom and dumped the child in the trash, according to court documents.

headline.main: Police: Woman Expected Baby to Die in Garbage Can
headline.print_headline: Police: Woman Expected Baby to Die in Garbage Can

docs.snippet: An Indianapolis woman whose co-workers found her newborn son gasping for air in a garbage can told a detective she expected the boy to die after she gave birth in a warehouse restroom and dumped the child in the trash, according to court documents.

docs.lead_paragraph: France has passed a sweeping gender equality law that eases current restrictions on abortion, encourages paternity leave and promotes gender parity at home and in the workplace.

headline.main: France Passes Sweeping Gender Equality Law
headline.print_headline: France Passes Sweeping Gender Equality Law

docs.snippet: France has passed a sweeping gender equality law that eases current restrictions on abortion, encourages paternity leave and promotes gender parity at home and in the workplace.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court could have the ultimate say on whether Arizona's new abortion-medication restrictions — considered the most stringent in the nation, but put on hold by a federal appeals court — should take effect.
docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court could have the ultimate say on whether Arizona's new abortion-medication restrictions — considered the most stringent in the nation, but put on hold by a federal appeals court — should take effect.

docs.lead_paragraph: Owners say stringent new standards could result in fewer than 10 abortion clinics across a sprawling state.

headline.main: Abortion Providers in Texas Press Judge to Block Portions of New Law
headline.print_headline: Abortion Providers in Texas Press Judge to Block Portions of New Law

docs.abstract: Abortion providers in Texas press judge to block portions of new state law that requires all abortion facilities to be licensed as ambulatory surgery centers; say new standards, set to take effect on Sept 1, could result in fewer than 10 abortion clinics in all of Texas.
docs.snippet: Owners say stringent new standards could result in fewer than 10 abortion clinics across a sprawling state.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Austin, and Erik Eckholm from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ERIK ECKHOLM

docs.lead_paragraph: Girls Inc. is starting a campaign to raise money and support for underprivileged girls in North America.
docs.abstract: Advertising column; Girls Inc is starting a public service advertising campaign to raise money and support for nearly 140,000 underprivileged girls in North America.
docs.snippet: Girls Inc. is starting a campaign to raise money and support for underprivileged girls in North America.

docs.lead_paragraph: Where a woman delivers her baby can make a major difference to her own health — a quality gap that remains largely hidden from mothers-to-be.

headline.main: Study: Wide Hospital Quality Gap on Maternity Care
headline.print_headline: Study: Wide Hospital Quality Gap on Maternity Care

docs.snippet: Where a woman delivers her baby can make a major difference to her own health — a quality gap that remains largely hidden from mothers-to-be.
